info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 9:59PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Poinsett and northwestern Cross Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 959 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hickory Ridge, or 18 miles southeast of Newport, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory Ridge, Fair Oaks, Fisher, Brushy Lake, Hydrick, Pittinger, Tilton and Fair Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
